titles.title: Allowing Body Cameras in Joint Task Forces Act of 2019

To provide that the head of a Federal agency may not prohibit State or local uniformed law enforcement officers from wearing or using body cameras on joint operations with Federal law enforcement officers, and for other purposes.
Allowing Body Cameras in Joint Task Forces Act of 2019

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.

bill.summary:
Allowing Body Cameras in Joint Task Forces Act of 2019
This bill bars a federal prohibition on the use or wearing of body cameras by state or local law enforcement officers during joint operations with federal law enforcement officers.
